body.name: Cyber Acoustics CA-3610 2.1 Multimedia Speaker System with Subwoofer, Perfect Computer Speakers for PC or Mac, Great for Music, Movies, and Gaming
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 13 hrs 57 mins
features: High-quality audio – 2.1 speakers with subwoofer deliver 62W peak power and 30W RMS. Each satellite features dual 2-inch titanium drivers that deliver crisp highs and warm mid-tones while the 5.25-inch down-firing subwoofer with tuned port puts out deep, powerful bass, for excellent sounding music, movies, or games.

Convenient control pod – Adjust volume or bass levels to customize your sound just the way you want it. Easily accessible 3.5mm aux input allows for quick connection of a gaming system or tablet or smartphone with a 3.5mm audio connection. Speakers also feature a headphone jack for a private listening experience.

Versatile usage – Speaker system works great as desktop computer speakers for PCs and Macs, or as PC speakers with any laptop. They are also great for gaming systems such as PS4, PS5, Xbox, or Nintendo Switch, tablets and smartphones with 3.5mm audio output or headphone jacks.
Attractive design – Satellites feature an angled design that look great on any desktop. The compact subwoofer fits under most desks and in smaller spaces.

Includes – CA-3610 2.1 speakers with subwoofer, 120V AC power adapter, and user guide. Includes 1 year manufacturer warranty. Our US based customer service team is here to help. Contact us through Amazon.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 2.1 Powered Speaker System CA-3610 With more than 50 million units sold, Cyber Acoustics has been a leader in audio products for more than 25 years. The CA-3610 features a modern curved design optimized for the best audio performance.

Subwoofer With a 4-inch Power Pro Series driver and bass control at your fingertips, this subwoofer delivers booming bass that is pleasantly surprising. Control Pod A desktop control pod turns the speakers on and off, adjusts the master volume, includes a headphone jack and AUX input, and LED power indicator. Satellites These satellites deliver mids and highs, working in harmony with the subwoofer. Small Footprint This system will leave a small footprint on your desk and your wallet. A PC speaker system by a company with over 25 years of experience.

Can I hook this up to my TV? It depends on the output capabilities of the TV. The TV must have a 3.5mm output. Usually these are headphone outputs. Does it work with laptops and MacBooks? Yes, as long as the device has a 3.5mm audio output. Can I plug this directly into my game controller? Although some game controllers do have 3.5mm audio output, plugging the green source plug into the controller can damage the source plug. If using the speakers this way it is recommended to use an AUX cable and the Aux port on the control pod. Do I need to install drivers for this? Our speaker systems use the generic drivers provided by your computer manufacturer. Where do I plug in the small speakers? The satellite speakers plug into the back of the subwoofer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars AMAZING sound, AMAZING price
reviews.reviewText: Wow. I have had various stereo and speaker combinations in the past, for different use-cases and under different circumstances; and for a home computer system in a bedroom that needs to be beefy yet compact, and offer quality features without being overly complicated, I really don't think there's a better offer out there. I would have paid $90 for it, easily (probably shouldn't say that - but hey, now I can buy two).Make sure you take your time, read what the inputs and outputs are, and TURN THE VOLUME ALL THE WAY DOWN (as well as turning the power off on the dial that comes with it). You wouldn't want to start your experience with this thing by having it blow out your ears - which it would. So just a quick precaution there. But beyond that, it was VERY simple to setup and the output for the tweeter pair that come with it is on the back of the woofer. And that's probably the last time you will have to deal with the woofer, thanks to their handy-dandy dial (be careful when handling the woofer so as not to impress the open speaker on the bottom, just fyi). I also elected to put the woofer on the floor instead of the desk (so as not to rattle my hard drives), and I can't even tell it's there because of how much the sound fills the room.The first track I put on to try it out HAD to be "Bad Boys," by Inner Circle - that song will always tell you what you're working with. I didn't hear any distortion unless I pumped it up way beyond what would be comfortable for me to listen to, and even at that, I had the woofer on 100% (which you generally don't need to do). The tweeters are bright, maybe brighter than one might expect, but when you get your woofer to 75% or so and dial-in that perfect balance, you will find that they really complement eachother and nothing feels lacking. Just to compare, I switched output to my desktop bluetooth speaker I was using previously (not a cheap one), and bam - it made that old speaker sound like a joke by comparison. I just couldn't believe how much audio detail and finer dynamic range I was missing. Such an improvement.I have this setup to come out of a home studio style mixer/audio interface combo, which receives its own audio signal from the computer. I've got to tell you - ABSOLUTELY amazing. Blew my mind, and that was without any EQ enhancement!Some reviewers have commented that the power button stops working after a certain amount of time... well as mentioned, part of the reason I bought this was to replace a desktop bluetooth speaker - which constantly turns off when not being used. And I wanted something that would just stay ON all the time, so I don't think that will be a problem for me. Also, the "auxiliary" output doesn't seem to work, but I haven't tried it with all possible receiving equipment, so I won't include that determination in my review. And honestly, even if I did, I believe I would still be rating it 5 stars.What sealed the deal in me taking a chance on this unit was that I also saw it was featured as part of a "Small Business" support type campaign in the description, and when I get a chance, I like to support small and up-and-coming enterprises. And as is often the case, I'm very glad I did.Bottom line? WORTH THE SHOT.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I got these for my office in a wood shop. When turned up you can hear the bass 50ft away on the shop floor over some of the machinery. They are much better than expected. The controller is great, very easy to adjust for the level of outside noise I want to cover up. The quality and workmanship are good. Hope they last a long time. If you turn the bass off the desktop speakers do not sound good by themselves, very tinny, but together they sound great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Ordered this speaker set around March, this review is being written Aug. 11th. The speakers just up and died completely!! No warning, no moving them around, not even touched, and now, they don't work at all! DO NOT BUY!! Not worth the money. DO NOT RECOMMEND!08/19/2023 UPDATE! Cyber Acoustics reached out to me after reading my review. They had me send them pics of the unit to make sure it wasn't something that I had done, and offered to replace the unit for me for free. They were very fast and the gentleman that I interacted with was very pleasant. The customer service was FANTASTIC!!! I am currently testing out the new unit, so far it has been AWESOME! The sound is amazing for the price. Very clean and crisp mids and high end, bass is noticeable but does not compromise the integrity of the other sounds when turned up. So far LOVING THIS UNIT!! Thanks Cyber Acoustics for being awesome!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent sound in a small space
reviews.reviewText: I like the compactness of the unit.I like the excellent quality of the sound, especially from the tweeters, however they do very poorly with midrange sound. I would recommend doing what I do: in addition to this unit I use two primarily midrange speakers, each with a three inch speaker (a cone I assume) to cover the midrange. With those added, you'll have a dynamite little sound system! I use a pair of Logitech speakers that include their own amplifier. I purchased them so long ago that I can't remember the model name/number. Sorry about that...The subwoofer is quite small but it does OK.Simple and easy to install !!! All that I had to do was plug in three plugs and it was up and running!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic set of speakers, well worth the money!
reviews.reviewText: I got these to replace an more expensive set of speakers that were twice the price, but it had developed a short in the cord that just kept getting worse. A friend helped me splice a new plug onto it, but that didn't last long. For a while I was just using my Alexa speaker, which has decent sound for what it is, but that doesn't compare to something with a subwoofer.I debated back and forth between this model and the two similar models with higher watts, but eventually settled on this on.It is really good! It's very loud, and was very easy to hookup.One review mentioned the volume adjuster part, which is two wires connected to a circle, and how it was poorly designed because the plugs are on the front... I almost didn't get this because of that, but it's not a concern whatsoever. Those to plugs are only for headphones or axillary, not for just plugging it in. And even so, I didn't find it to be in the way.The only cons, which seem to be very common with all of these, doesn't matter the brand, is that the audio cables and the speaker wires are hard wired. I don't understand why they can't just make these removable plugs. Not only does it make setup a lot easier (putting the speaker where you want it and then running the wires, rather than having to move things and adjust things out of the way because everything is connected), but it doesn't allow you to replace them later if they get damaged (or if you just wanted a longer cable).
I’m a month in and pretty happy with these. The bass could be a little more deep instead of cheap sounding. But for 70 bucks their pretty good!

Die Anlage kommt wohl direkt aus der USA-dementsprechend ist die Gebrauchsanweisung auch nur in Englisch und Spanisch.Der Elektro-Stecker ist auch nur die US -Ausführung, das heißt, zu dieser Sündhaft-teuren Anlage muß man sich noch ein EU-Adapter-Stecker dazu bestellen!! was ich auch getan habe.Dummerweise ist die Anlage nicht auf unseren 220V Strom ausgelegt, um es kurz zu machen:Stecker in Steckdose, Sämtliche Sicherungen in meiner Wohnung raus, viel stinkerei, Subwoofer gekillt!!!!!und das war's mit dieser "tollen" Anlage.Also an alle Nachkäufer: unbedingt einen Stromwandler dazwischen schalten!!!Es sollte doch bei diesem Preis möglich sein, so einen Umformer mitzuliefern!?!?

reviews.reviewTitle: So good they got me in trouble!
reviews.reviewText: The very day the speakers arrived, my hearing aids stopped working (later found to be a wax blockage in both ears).I set the speakers up in my apartment just barely loud enough for me to hear. At 9 pm my next-door neighbour came to my door to ask me to turn my "radio" down. I was so embarrassed and apologetic because I've never had a noise complaint before. So please be assured of the great volume and quality from these speakers. lol.
Delivery was very quick I am very pleased with these speakers. They give a clear sound. There is a large volume range and the bass is great. The price is also great. Love this product.
I received this product and no sound was coming out of the speakers.Unusable and broken, so disappointed, do not buy from BTE Computer Inc.
